        Myrtle Beach Vacation Rentals

        With more than 100 golf courses along a 75-mile Atlantic coastal strip, 1,600 restaurants, beaches, shopping complexes, amusement parks and live entertainment theaters, you’ve got lots of choices to make in Myrtle Beach. Perhaps your most important decision is where to stay. How about a roomy vacation rental instead of a small hotel room? Myrtle Beach has an amazing inventory of beachfront rentals, condos, cottages, cabins and villas that offer you spacious accommodations and a great base to explore the phenomenal entertainment options in the area. Whatever you choose, rest assured, we’ll help you find the right place for you and your family at a great price.

        Myrtle Beach attractions and activities

        Sixty miles of sandy beaches provide the perfect venue for a variety of family-oriented water sport activities, including sailing, jet skiing, deep-sea fishing, snorkeling and scuba diving. Golfers will find great value at top-notch courses designed by golf architects like Pete Dye, Jack Nicklaus, Tom Fazio and Greg Norman. Saltwater marshes, dense native forests and the Intracoastal Waterway provide major features of many designs. In the evening, enjoy live family-friendly entertainment at The Carolina Opry, Dolly Parton’s Dixie Stampede Dinner & Show and Medieval Times Dinner & Tournament. Shop till you drop at a wide selection of shopping malls, factory outlets, specialty shops and flea markets.

        Day trips in the Myrtle Beach area

        Fill up your tank and some fabulous day trips await you. Charleston, the antebellum city loaded with historic buildings and Civil War sites, is less than a two-hour drive. The colonial city of Georgetown, where you can lunch at a waterfront café and then walk the oak-lined streets, is a 35-minute drive. If fishing or bird watching is appealing, head twenty-five minutes south to Pawley’s Island, a barrier island.

        Family vacation rentals in Myrtle Beach

        Beach house? High-rise condo? Cottage? If you’re looking for a vacation rental on or near the sandy beaches, there are several areas to consider, including North Myrtle Beach, Central Myrtle Beach, Surfside Beach and Garden City Beach. Regardless of where you stay, you’re never far from golf, beaches, shopping and entertainment. For families, Myrtle Beach has one of the best tourism infrastructures anywhere. There’s something to enjoy for every member of the family.

        Saving money on Myrtle Beach vacation rentals

        If you opt for a vacation house with a pool and a fully-equipped kitchen, you can save money and prepare a phenomenal meal while the kids splash away. Some rental homes have spacious patios where you can grill steaks, burgers and hot dogs and let the good times roll. It sure beats the high prices and hassles of dining out.
